messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: jsa@... [mailto:jsa@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 08, 2004 6:58 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] creative use of JUnit
>
>
> Hy,
>
> I've been using JUnit for unit tests quite successfully for
> some time now.
> Now I've started working on a framework to test the
> configuration & setup
> of a running system. I've noticed several similarities between the
> framework I built and JUnit and I plan to port this framework
> on top of
> JUnit, now I've got some questions on the nature of JUnit
> that I didn't
> need to know until now.
>
> Is the number returned by Test.countTestCases() binding? I
> ask because my
> check framework can't tell in advance how many checks it will
> have to do
> (it could but that would increase development effort quite a
> lot, and I'd
> like to avoid that).

If I understand correctly you would like to know if the number of tests
returned by Test.countTestCases() has any bearing on the operation of
the JUnit test runner. I think it is only used in updating the progress
bar. If you don't mind an inaccurate progress bar you will probably be
ok if countTestCases() returns an inaccurate number
